class_notes:
(Same as MESAS 330 1)
(This course will introduce Tibetan people, their folk, spiritual, belief system, rituals, religion and ceremonies as well as the functioning of the monastics and lay communities of the society. The course will also dwell on understanding the moral, ethical, political and mystical aspects of Tibetan traditions and culture. For further questions contact: trigzin@emory.edu)
course_description: This is an introductory course on Tibetan culture focusing on selected themes and perspectives of Tibetan culture.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 4450, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 1-2:15p, Instructor: T. Rigzin, Status: Closed
